Magnus,  I just downloaded eco 0.7 and tried to compile it.  I received n=
umerous errors.  It appears I am missing some files.  Would you know where =
I could find these?  I am including the make error below.
 
     Best regar=
ds,

           Ty

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "torvhydda" <torvhydd=
a@...> wrote:
>
> 
> 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "chhofchhof" <Christia=
n.Hofmann@> wrote:
> 
> > Do you know tricks to handle that amount of data?=

> 
> Hi!
> 
> Dunno how your setup is, but if you plan to activate each or=
ganism only few times per generation I guess you could try the neat code fr=
om eco.
> 
> I've put a patch to the v0.7 release, called huge.patch.gz, in=
 the eco folder. Beware though, it uses s**tload of memory (around 700Mb) f=
or a population of 25 organisms and 3001 inputs (bias is the first) & 150 o=
utputs. It takes around 15 minutes on a 2 GHZ computer to run 100 generatio=
ns. Run the test program and choose the HUGE test.
> 
> Patch v0.7 and grab=
 neat.c neat.h error.h and include them in your project. Have a look at tes=
t.c to see how to use. Note that only Feed Forward networks are possible to=
 evolve after patching, due to my laziness for the moment :)
> 
> /Magnus
>=
